info.payouts: Confirmed payments from matured blocks, including rewards from valid sharenotes. Useful for tracking completed earnings and verifying received funds.
info.payoutsSummary: Total paid rewards over time, grouped by period to help track payout frequency and spot trends.
info.sharenotesSummary: Valid sharenotes grouped by hour and worker, representing ongoing mining work awaiting block maturity.
info.workersInsights: Per-worker overview highlighting the current sharenote in progress, printing speed, and latest printed sharenote.
info.pendingShares: Data shows last 500 pending sharenotes or last 2 days. Workers with valid sharenotes from blocks still awaiting maturity or payment, queued for future payouts once confirmations complete.
info.workersProfit: Unpaid, immature rewards by worker over time — amounts may change once blocks confirm.
info.hashrateChart: Hashrate over time for all or selected workers, with live and averaged view options.
info.liveSharenotes: A live chart showing how many sharenotes workers print for each block on the parent chain.

pageNotFound: This page could not be found

workersInsights.info.sharenotes: Most recent sharenote printed by this worker.
workersInsights.info.meanTime: Average time this worker takes to print a sharenote.
workersInsights.info.lastShare: Elapsed time since this worker last printed a sharenote.

questions.a: Sharenote is a miner-controlled proof-of-work note minted for each accepted share. Learn more at [[link:shareNote:shareNote]].

questions.q: Do all mining pools publish sharenotes?
questions.a: No. Only pools that follow the Sharenote FEP publish them. Ask your pool if they support [[link:sharenoteFep:sharenoteFep]].

questions.q: Who submits sharenotes during the Without Breaking Existing Things (WBET) stage?
questions.a: Your pool—the work provider—signs and publishes your sharenotes. mySharenote just reads them.
mySharenote is the WBET dashboard that watches your sharenotes and shows live shares and payouts.

questions.q: How do I set up mySharenote?
questions.a: Open Settings, paste the setup data from your work provider, and save. mySharenote stays read-only and just watches the sharenotes they publish.
Your mining pool shares the setup info—just copy it into Settings.

questions.q: Do I need new hardware or a different pool?
questions.a: No. The WBET rollout keeps your current miner and pool. mySharenote only monitors the sharenotes they already mint.
Double-check the settings you pasted and confirm your pool lets you read their relay. Ask them for access or a public mirror if needed.

questions.q: Where can I explore the bigger WoF picture?
questions.a: Start with the [[link:wofPaper:wofPaper]] and watch [[link:shareNote:shareNote]] for new FEP rollouts.
